bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, December 20, 1950

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that he has been elected vice-president of the Reed Memorial Association, and hopes that he will accept. The former vice president, Ireland, has been hospitalized for several months.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, December 20, 1950
div1.opener:
2220 - 20th Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
December 20, 1950.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
We were sorry that you were unable to be present at the annual meeting
of the Board of Managers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association which was
held on December 14, 1950.

At the meeting, the Board elected you to succeed Major General M. W.
Ireland as Vice President. As you are aware, General Ireland has been in
Walter Reed General Hospital with a serious illness for several months. We
feel sure that all concerned will understand our motives.

We hope that you can accept the office. We will feel greatly honored
to have such a distinguished physician as our Vice President.
A copy of the minutes of the meeting will be sent to you soon.

With kindest regards, all good wishes for the holiday season and, again,
congratulations on the well-deserved recognition of your splendid work which
has recently been accorded you, I am

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), U.S.A., Ret'd.
President, Walter Reed
Memorial Association
